history.content: I would try to audit. If you're a transfer student who is fairly familiar with the concepts, you should be okay not taking 61B, and having 61B and 61C projects together sounds fairly painful. I would just take all three classes and sit in on 61B as need be.

children.subject: 186 relies on knowledge of Java that assumes you've already taken 61B. It would be extremely painful to go into that class without knowing Java.

Thanks.. but what if I want to do the project since I was not too familiar with Java? Would it be best to just take 61B and drop one upper div? The concepts are all familiar to me but I want to gain practice through the projects, and I am not really sure what else I could do

history.content: I am a transfer student planning to take data structure again to review the concepts. So I would probably do P/NP for CS 61B to relieve the stress. Now I am wondering between CS 186 and CS 188, which one should I pick to take it with CS 61B and C? Or should I just audit CS 61B instead and take both CS 188 and CS 186 with CS 61C? Thank you for the help.
history.subject: CS 186 or CS 188 with CS 61B and CS 61C
